intro: Psychotria spithamea subsp. spithamea, commonly known as the red-eyed cycad, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its striking red bracts that surround the inflorescence, giving it its common name. The plant is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. It typically grows as an understory plant in tropical rainforests, thriving in humid and shaded environments. Its botanical features include pinnately compound leaves and small, clustered flowers.
